title: How to Draw in Museums: Manet & Mokgosi—Oysters/Butter/Bread, Part II
hero_caption: Édouard Manet. Fish (Still Life), 1864. Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Larned Coburn Memorial Collection.
short_description: Look across time and space, and explore themes of lyricism, history, and contemporary life.
list_description: A two-part workshop presented by the Smart Museum of Art and the Art Institute of Chicago
description:
In Part Two of this two-part series, jump from Manet’s monumental and groundbreaking paintings into Meleko Mokgosi’s in Meleko Mokgosi: Bread, Butter, and Power, a twenty-panel oil painting installation exploring themes of feminism in the context of southern Africa.

This is part II of a two-part series happening at two Chicago art museums this fall and winter. Part I was a workshop was a series of sketching exercises and discussion of the Art Institute’s collection of paintings by Edouard Manet as well as those of his predecessors.

These two programs together look across time and space, and explore themes of lyricism, history, and contemporary life.

Presented by the Smart Museum of Art and the Art Institute of Chicago.
location: The Smart Museum of Art at the University of Chicago
